      Registers with the server, start the Cliche CLI and keep the connection open until the client exits or the server is down for more than 60s.

      Prints out the incoming message.

      boolean register(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String privateAddress)
      Registers with another client.
      void run()
      This thread runs a polling function which checks if the server and the chat partner, if you're in a private room, is still alive.
      java.lang.Void sendMessage(java.lang.String senderName, java.lang.String message)
      Allows a client to send a message to private room.
      boolean sendVideoRequest(java.lang.String file)
      Allows videostreaming to be intitiated between two clients.
      void startLocalServer()
      Starts a server for the client, so the client can also receive commands from other servers and clients.

      • configure

        public void configure(java.lang.String[] args)
        Reads in the command line arguments to configure the client, or uses defaults if none are given.
        Parameters:
        args - The given command line arguments. Execute client with 'help' as argument to see the options.

      • connectToServer

        public void connectToServer()
        Registers with the server, start the Cliche CLI and keep the connection open until the client exits or the server is down for more than 60s.

      • incomingMessage

      • inPrivateRoom

        public boolean inPrivateRoom()
                      throws org.apache.avro.AvroRemoteException
        Simple method to test if the client is still alive.
        Specified by:
        inPrivateRoom in interface ChatClientServer
        Returns:
        null Returns null if it it can answer and is thus still alive.
        Throws:
        org.apache.avro.AvroRemoteException

        public java.lang.Void isAlive()
                       throws org.apache.avro.AvroRemoteException
        Simple method to test if the client is still alive.

      • leave

        public java.lang.Void leave(boolean closeOtherProxy)
                     throws org.apache.avro.AvroRemoteException
        Leave a private chat and call on the other participant to automatically do the same.
        Specified by:
        leave in interface ChatClientServer
        Parameters:
        closeOtherProxy - Whether or not your participants chat must also be closed. Necessary to avoid an endless recursion loop.
        Throws:
        org.apache.avro.AvroRemoteException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method for the client. Configures and starts a chatClient. Then connect to the server.
        Parameters:
        args - CLI arguments which are passed to the configure function.

      • reconnect

        private void reconnect(int n)
        Tries to ping the server up to n times in increasing intervals (multiples of 5). Give up after 75 seconds.
        Parameters:
        n - Number of recent failed attempts to reconnect to server.

      • register

        public boolean register(java.lang.String username,
                        java.lang.String privateAddress)
                 throws org.apache.avro.AvroRemoteException
        Registers with another client.
        Specified by:
        register in interface ChatClientServer
        Parameters:
        username - Name of the client to register to.
        privateAddress - Address of the client to register to.
        Returns:
        boolean Whether or not the connection was successfully made.
        Throws:
        org.apache.avro.AvroRemoteException

      • run

        public void run()
        This thread runs a polling function which checks if the server and the chat partner, if you're in a private room, is still alive.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • sendMessage

        public java.lang.Void sendMessage(java.lang.String senderName,
                                  java.lang.String message)
                           throws org.apache.avro.AvroRemoteException
        Allows a client to send a message to private room.
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in interface ChatClientServer
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be delivered.
        Throws:
        org.apache.avro.AvroRemoteException

      • sendVideoRequest

        public boolean sendVideoRequest(java.lang.String file)
                         throws org.apache.avro.AvroRemoteException
        Allows videostreaming to be intitiated between two clients.
        Specified by:
        sendVideoRequest in interface ChatClientServer
        Parameters:
        file - The video file to be transmitted.
        Returns:
        boolean Binary client answer to the request
        Throws:
        org.apache.avro.AvroRemoteException

      • startLocalServer

        public void startLocalServer()
        Starts a server for the client, so the client can also receive commands from other servers and clients. This emulates push based (server side) communication.
